page.title: 12HAMLETS/HOUSES IN CULMSTOCK
page.content: In this particular area, we have three picturesque HAMLETS, namely, PRESCOTT, NICHOLASHAYNE and WOODGATE. Public footpaths are walked regularly and kept open. The original TITHE BARN now houses 4 cottages and GYPSY FARM and OLD BEAT are names surviving from days of SQUATTERS when a house was built and the land on which it stood, and often that surrounding it, were claimed. Old Beat refers to burning of scrubland before cultivation took place. OLD HALL in Prescott is one of the very earliest buildings in the Parish - this is still inhabited and farmed as a smallholding of 15 acres. POND FARM and TUCKER'S FARM at Nicholashayne are self-explanatory (a 'tucker' being a labourer in the cloth industry), for which Culmstock was a centre.
